level.text: Owners of all motor vehicles subject to unresolved emissions recall notices issued after November 1,1998, shall provide proof at the next motor vehicle inspection or vehicle registration renewal date that the necessary repairs were completed.

Failure to complete the required recall repairs, and to provide proof that the repairs were completed, shall result in the failed inspection of the vehicle or the denial of vehicle registration, whichever occurs first.
Proof of recall repairs shall be documented by electronic records or paper receipts provided by a certified IM-240 automotive emissions repair technician.
Documentation verifying required repairs shall include the following:
The VIN, make, and model year of the vehicle;
A description of the repairs made; and
Compliance with this section shall be required at the next registration or inspection date, allowing a reasonable period to comply, after notification of recall is received by the District.
